QUOTE

Professional Proposal Quote Service Order

Client: AIR TEAM intel, s.r.o.

Petr Polak

Delivered on: 03/21/2025

Submitted by: Michelle Arellano

www.breanetworks.com

www.cmmccompliance.us

Quote

Dear {{doc.client_name}},

Thank you for the opportunity to provide you with a quote. We look forward to building a new partnership with you. As discussed, here's a preliminary quote for AIR TEAM intel, s.r.o.

We understand that you have other choices when seeking IT compliance and government solutions, and we thank you for considering us. We are committed to operational excellence and customer service, focusing on quality of service, clear communication, and simplification in providing the best solutions for your business.

Our mission at {{doc.our_company}} is to accelerate businesses like yours to become compliant, secure, and successful through our Unlimited IT Compliance as a service program.

Please let us know if this quote reflects everything we discussed and what you expected. If not, we can quickly revise it to reflect your needs. If the quote is on target, please proceed by digitally accepting the quote and processing payment.

{{doc.our_company}} is a Registered Provider Organization (RPO) with the Cyber AB board. You may verify our status by clicking here.

{{doc.our_company}} is also ITAR/EAR and DFARS-compliant company MSP. This compliance includes DFARS 252.204-7012 Safeguarding Covered Defense Information and Cyber Incident Reporting. As part of being compliant with DFARS 252.204-7012, the company meets 110% of the 110 controls in NIST SP 800-171 (latest version) as well as the extra 20 controls required to become prepared for CMMC Certification at Level 3.

CMMC Certification at Level 2 is the mandatory minimum CMMC Certification preparedness level required to handle CUI or Controlled Unclassified Information. CUI Information has special and specific hardening requirements that a Prime or Subcontractor are required to meet properly store and transmit CUI information.

It is important to understand that many projects for the DoD require the Safeguarding of Covered Defense Information. Information such as building plans, blueprints, technical drawings, construction methods, measurements, tolerances, material lists, and even financial information can be considered valuable information to an adversary.

The number one threat to national security is information system attack (both physical information such as printed blueprints and digital information such as that held in the company's information systems). Because of this very real risk, the Department of Defense has mandated by law that those businesses which it does business with (spends money with) must meet the minimum requirements written into law in the DFARS or Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement.

Thank you again for the opportunity to provide you with a quote. We look forward to exceeding your expectations.

Regards,

ITAR Compliance Package - Travel Paid by {{doc.our_company}}
1 {{doc.travel_paid_1}} Not Selected
Total Employees: 20
● ITAR Compliance Package - AIR TEAM intel (2 locations included)
Service Description: Our ITAR/EAR Compliance Services help organizations meet U.S. export control laws by ensuring secure handling, storage, and access to ITAR-controlled data. We provide registration support, security controls implementation, personnel screening, vendor compliance audits, and ongoing monitoring to prevent unauthorized access and maintain regulatory compliance. This package includes unlimited compliance support, guidance, education, and implementation in relation to ITAR/EAR and for the included scope of work.
Tasks & Activities:
  1. ITAR compliance requirements to handle ITAR/EAR data
  2. Subcontractor and supplier assessment for ITAR/EAR
  3. Private labeled company Policies for ITAR/EAR
  4. Private labeled company SOPs and Forms for ITAR/EAR
  5. Sixty (60) day compliance support, guidance, and implementation in relation to ITAR/EAR
  6. Custom ITAR/EAR project plan management and coordination
  7. Audit of physical facilities and personnel for ITAR/EAR
  8. Identification & Classification of ITAR/EAR-Controlled Data & Materials
  9. Physical Security Hardening & Access Control Implementation
  10. Personnel Screening for ITAR/EAR Compliance
  11. Third-Party Vendor & Supplier Screening ITAR/EAR Compliance Assessment
  12. ITAR/EAR-Specific Training for Employees Handling Controlled Data
  13. Includes a custom ITAR Program Manual (155-175 pages)
  14. Includes an ITAR Memo Template
  15. Includes an ITAR Board of Directors Agreement (BoD) Template
  16. Documentation will be licensed and copywritten to one company only (Air Team Intel)
Dedicated Resources for the Project:
  • ITAR Consultant – Specialist in ITAR implementation and regulatory compliance.
Discovery and Initial Assessment Activities:
  • Questionnaire and Interview Discovery – In-depth session to assess the current compliance posture.
  • ITAR Data Flow Discussion – Analysis of ITAR data handling and processes.
Onsite Visit (2 Days Onsite):
  • All travel expenses included with the onsite visit are included with this ITAR package.
  • Limited only to one (1) person and two (2) locations.
  • Questionnaire Interview and ITAR Discussion Onsite – Real-time compliance review and Q&A
  • Facility Walkthrough – Evaluation of physical security controls and operational readiness.
  • Hands-on engagement to assess and guide compliance efforts.
  • Initial Review of Policies, Procedures, and IT Architecture.
  • ITAR onsite Training – Includes a Q/A session with all employees

Please Note: Travel expenses associated with onsite visits are covered by {{doc.our_company}}.

Client Responsibilities:
  • The client is responsible for compliance remediation costs in relation to hardware, physical security ITAR signage and markings, software, ITAR/EAR solutions.
  • The client is responsible for ITAR/EAR legal fees associated to DSP and TAA filings with the DDTC if the product needs to be exported to other locations not approved by L3 Harris.

Please contact us if you have any questions.

Total One-Time       $ 200002321
ACCEPT QUOTE
Comments
Please Note:

This engagement has a duration of sixty (60) days and will start upon receipt of payment.

Technical Support Agreement

(Including Terms of Service and Nondisclosure Provisions)

This Technical Support Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into as of the Effective Date specified in Section 1 below between AIR TEAM s.r.o. ("Client", "you" and "your"), with its principal place of business at Masarykovo nám. 354 66471 Veverská Bítýška 0000, and {{doc.our_company}}, LLC, a California limited liability company ("{{doc.our_company}}", "we", "us" and "our"), with its principal place of business at 451 W. Lambert Road, Suite 214, Brea, CA 92821 to render the services and/or sell the products identified in Section 2 below, and {{doc.our_company}} desires to accept such engagement upon the terms and conditions set forth below. Products and Services (as defined below) that {{doc.our_company}} may provide or sell to Client will only be delivered to Client pursuant to one or more quotes, work orders, purchase orders or service orders (each collectively referred to herein as a “Service Order”). Once executed by Client and {{doc.our_company}}, a Service Order becomes part of this Agreement.

1.0 TERM AND PAYMENT

1.1 Commencement Date and Initial Term.

The term for each service will commence on 03/21/2025 ("Effective Date") and shall continue for the entire initial term of one (1) year ("Initial Term"). This Agreement shall continue in full force and effect until termination.

1.2 Renewal Term.

Upon completion of the Initial Term, this Agreement will renew automatically for successive one-year periods (each a "Renewal Term") unless Client notifies {{doc.our_company}} in writing, not less than thirty (30) calendar days prior to the end of the Initial Term (or any subsequent Renewal Term, as applicable), that Client wishes to terminate this Agreement.

1.3 Price Increases Following Initial Term.

At any time following the Initial Term, {{doc.our_company}} shall have the right to increase the cost of any Services or price of subsequently purchased Products (as those terms are defined below) upon thirty (30) days' written notice to Client. If Client and {{doc.our_company}} mutually agree in writing to amend this Agreement in order to establish a new term of a fixed number of months or years (a "New Term") the pricing will be fixed for that New Term.

1.4 Termination Without Cause During Initial Term.

Except in the case of termination for cause under Section 1.6 below, any actual or attempted termination of this Agreement by Client prior to the end of the Initial Term or any New Term shall constitute a breach of contract by Client. In the event of such actual or attempted termination, the sum of all remaining monthly payments due hereunder through the end of the Initial Term shall be immediately due and payable without notice or demand. The provisions of Sections 3, 7, 8, and 10 shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

1.5 Termination Without Cause Following Initial Term.

Either party may terminate this Agreement in its entirety or with respect to any specific Service, without cause, following the Initial Term or any New Term. Such termination will be effective on the date set forth in the terminating party’s notice to the other party, provided, however, that the termination date shall not occur less than thirty (30) days following the date on which the termination notice is delivered.

1.6 Termination for Cause.

This Agreement may be terminated by either party for cause. Cause is defined as the commission by the non-terminating party of a material breach of its obligations under this Agreement, including without limitation fraud, gross negligence or intentional misconduct. A party wishing to terminate for cause shall send written notice to the breaching party, describing the nature of the breach. If the breach is not cured within ten days (in the case of a monetary breach) or thirty days (in the case of all other breaches), this Agreement shall automatically terminate.

1.7 Termination of Individual Services.

The termination of any individual Service provided under this Agreement will not affect Client’s obligations to accept and pay for all other Services which Client has contracted to receive under this Agreement.

1.8 Payment Terms.

Services as defined in Section 2 below, including monthly support services, are billed monthly in advance. All work done outside of the scope of this Agreement will require prior written authorization from Client in the form of a quotation or work order form signed by both parties. All other fees for Services, hardware, or products received and expenses incurred by {{doc.our_company}} on behalf of Client shall be invoiced separately at the time of delivery or when the Services are rendered. Payment is due upon receipt of invoice. Should Client fail to make payment within ten days after the date of the invoice, the invoice will be considered "past due." When Client makes payment on the invoice that is considered past due, Client shall be deemed to be making a "late payment" on the invoice.

1.9 Late Payments

The following rules will apply whenever an invoice becomes past due. Client will pay interest on the invoice calculated from the date of the invoice to the date of the actual payment. The interest will accrue at a rate of three percent (3%) per month or the highest rate allowed by applicable law, whichever is lower. If Client’s account becomes past due, Client will have a cure period of five (5) business days to make payment on the invoice. If Client fails to make payment within the five-(5) business days {{doc.our_company}} may halt Services until Client makes full payment on the invoice. While Services are halted Client shall not accrue any credit for fees on any current or subsequent invoice. Client may re-establish Services by paying all past-due amounts and interest accrued thereon, plus a reactivation fee of 10% of your monthly invoice. If Client contacts {{doc.our_company}} to discuss payment on a past due invoice & requests continued Services, {{doc.our_company}} may in its sole discretion continue to provide Services; however, such continued performance shall not constitute a waiver of the right to halt Services at any time until payment on the invoice is received. Additionally, if Client continues to be habitually delinquent in its payments, {{doc.our_company}} may, upon written notice to Client, modify the payment terms to require full monthly payment in advance of providing monthly Services or require written assurances to secure Client’s payment obligations hereunder. Client shall be considered to be habitually delinquent hereunder if Client makes two (2) or more sequential late payments or three (3) late payments in any 6-month period.

1.10 Payment For Service Subscriptions

With respect to payment for Service Subscriptions, if there is any conflict between this Section 1 and Section 6.6 below, section 6.6 shall govern.

2.0 PRODUCTS AND SERVICES

2.1 Services Scope

{{doc.our_company}} will provide Client with Information and Technology (IT) services (hereinafter referred to as the “Services”). See Quote 1888 v6 “ Statement of Services Offered” for a detailed itemization of services scope.

2.2 Products Purchased

{{doc.our_company}} will provide Client with hardware, software and other products (hereinafter referred to as the “Products”). See Quote 1888 v6 – Description of Products Provided” for a detailed itemization of the Products purchased by Client hereunder and the prices to be paid by Client for those Products.

2.3 Authority and Notification

Client grants {{doc.our_company}} permission to download and/or install software on Client’s computers, including but not limited to, virus scanners, diagnosis and repair utilities, drivers, libraries, updates, service packs and any software requested to be installed by the Client.

2.4 Access

Client grants {{doc.our_company}} full access to Client’s computers. For onsite services Client grants {{doc.our_company}}, its agents and service representatives, access and permission to physically install and/or disassemble any and all computer and/or network components including but not limited to complete systems and/or any hardware components requested to be installed by Client.

2.5 Additional Provisions Pertaining to Federal Cybersecurity Requirements

{{doc.our_company}} has the ability to assist government contractors in complying with federal cybersecurity requirements imposed by the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), the Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS), National Institute of Standards and Technology Special Publication (NIST SP) 800-171, PCI-DSS, ITAR, and Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification (CMMC) levels 1-3. If the Services listed on your quote 1888 v6 include assisting you in complying with any such requirements, you acknowledge and agree that: (a) {{doc.our_company}} has no way of predicting what FAR, DFARS, NIST SP 800-171 and/or CMMC level compliance problems may arise in connection with your business and your computer networks; (b) {{doc.our_company}} has no control over how you may implement compliance measures or protocols, and (c) {{doc.our_company}} cannot guaranty that you will successfully achieve or maintain CMMC Certification. You, the Client, are responsible for ensuring that you are fully compliant with FARS, DFARS, NIST SP 800-171 and CMMC requirements, notwithstanding that fact that {{doc.our_company}} will (if so indicated in the listed Services) endeavor to help you achieve such compliance. Without limiting the general application of the release and liquidated damages provisions of Sections 8.4 and 8.5 below, those release and liquidated damages provisions shall apply to claims raised by you based on any failure by you to comply with FAR, DFARS, NIST SP 800-171 and CMMC requirements or your failure to achieve or maintain CMMC Certification or any other regulatory compliance issues. Furthermore, any third-party claims based on any such failure shall constitute “Claims” for the purposes of Section 10 below.

3.0 RELATIONSHIP OF PARTIES

3.1 Independent Contractor

{{doc.our_company}} shall for all purposes be considered an independent contractor, and nothing in this Agreement shall be deemed to place the parties in the relationship of employer-employee, principal-agent, partners or joint venturers. {{doc.our_company}} shall complete the services required of it hereunder according to its own means and methods of work, which shall be in the exclusive charge and control of {{doc.our_company}} and not subject to the control or supervision of Client except as to the results of the work and except as otherwise specifically set forth in this Agreement.

3.2 Non-Exclusivity

{{doc.our_company}} may perform like services for persons and entities other than Client during the term of this Agreement, including any other individual or entity that competes with Client or offers services similar to those offered by Client, and such performance shall not be considered a breach of this Agreement.

3.3 Client’s Intellectual Property

Client retains all right, title, and interest in and to all of Client’s intellectual property rights transmitted by or on behalf of Client to {{doc.our_company}} in connection with the Services. {{doc.our_company}} may not modify or create derivative works from or copy any ideas, features, functions, or graphics of the or modify or make derivative works based thereon. {{doc.our_company}} may use this information in accordance herewith and with other written directives (if any) from Client in connection with providing Services to Client and otherwise will not disclose or use Client IP for any purpose.

3.4 {{doc.our_company}}’ Intellectual Property

{{doc.our_company}} retains all right, title, and interest in and to all works of authorship, and all intellectual property therein that (i) existed prior to the date that {{doc.our_company}} began performing Services for Client, or (ii) is developed independently from the Services. Any policies, forms, standard operating procedures, instructional manuals, compliance documentation and other documentation, software or products created by {{doc.our_company}} for Client is owned by {{doc.our_company}} and protected by copyright laws, and Client receives only a non-transferrable license to use those things, as more thoroughly set forth in Section 5.1 below. You may not sell share or otherwise disclose (privately or publicly) to any other person or entity (including your affiliates) any of the foregoing items or any other of {{doc.our_company}}’ compliance documentation or trade secrets, without the prior written consent of {{doc.our_company}}, which consent may be granted, conditioned or withheld in our sole and absolute discretion.

3.5 Non-Solicitation

Client acknowledges that {{doc.our_company}} employees and contractors/consultants constitute a valuable asset of {{doc.our_company}}, and that its ability to perform its services for Client hereunder (and for other persons and entities under separate contracts) requires human resource continuity. During the term of this Agreement and for thirty-six (36) months after its termination, Client will not attempt to retain or employ the services of any {{doc.our_company}} employee or contractor/consultant.

3.6 Authorized Agents

Client understands and agrees that {{doc.our_company}} may use independent third-party contractors (sometimes referred to herein as “Authorized Agents”) to support particular portions of the infrastructure or service (Example: hardware or software vendors). {{doc.our_company}} will monitor activity and access of Authorized Agents on Client’s infrastructure.

4.0 NO HIGH-RISK USE

Client may not use the Products or Services in any situation where failure or fault of the Products or Services could lead to death or serious bodily injury of any person, or to physical or environmental damage. Examples include but are not limited to Products or Services in connection with aircraft or other modes of human mass transportation, nuclear or chemical facilities, or Class III medical devices under the Federal Food, Drug and Cosmetic Act. Should Client breach this term, Client agrees to allow {{doc.our_company}} to terminate Services and Client agrees to assume any and all liability for any third party claims arising from said termination, use of Products or Services, or incidents arising out of this Agreement. Should Client knowingly or unknowingly providing Services to any third party engaging in such high risk use such that said third party is indirectly relying on {{doc.our_company}}, Client agrees to allow termination of Services and agrees to assume all liability as though Client was the third party.

5.0 USE OF PRODUCTS AND SERVICES

5.1 Grant of License by {{doc.our_company}} to Client

Subject to your compliance with the terms of this Agreement and the receipt by us of all fees applicable to the Products and Services, {{doc.our_company}} grants you a limited, revocable, non-sublicensable, non-exclusive right and license to access and use the Products and Services in accordance with their specifications. If your use of any of the Products or Services involves the use of backup and remote access agent software, remote access agent software, or other agent software, you hereby agree to the terms of all applicable agent software licenses.

5.2 Third Party Technology/License Terms

Certain Products and Services may involve or allow the use of third-party technology or software (for example and without limitation, Microsoft® software). You agree that your use of the Products or Services is deemed your express consent to all such applicable third-party terms. Brea Network is not responsible for any damages you may incur, or any claims against you, based on your failure to comply with any such third-party terms. For all Microsoft licenses, client agrees to abide by Microsoft Cloud Agreements including license term and any early cancellation penalties. {{doc.our_company}} also reserves the right to pass through any price changes imposed by Microsoft or other third-party vendors. Some Services to be provided by {{doc.our_company}} cannot be performed unless Client accepts a third-party licensing agreement, which Client agrees to accept as a condition to receiving the Services.

5.3 Additional Data Processing Terms

Products and Services may be configured to designate the geographic region where Content (as defined in Section 5.4 below) associated with a Product is stored. The European Data Processing Addendum is incorporated into this Agreement if a Product is configured to store Content in the European Economic Area or the United Kingdom. If you are a USA based government related firm, government contractor, local, state, or federal agency, we have special configuration setup to make sure all your data will be stored in USA based data centers to comply with CMMC, CMMG Level 1-3 and ITAR requirements.

5.4 Grant by Client to {{doc.our_company}} of License to Client's Content

Client's use of the Products and Services may involve the inputting, downloading, uploading, storage, processing and/or delivery by Client of data, files and other information produced by Client or third parties ("Content"). On behalf of Client and any person or entity whom Client allows to use the Products and/or Services ("End User"), (i) you represent and warrant that you and/or the End User has sufficient rights and all required third party consents, permissions or licenses in and to the Content as may be necessary and appropriate for use of the Content with the Products and Services; and (ii) you hereby grant to {{doc.our_company}} a limited, royalty-free, non-exclusive, assignable license to copy, reformat, disclose, transmit, display and otherwise use the Content as necessary or desired, in each case solely for the purposes of providing the Product or Service or as otherwise necessary for {{doc.our_company}} to exercise its rights under this Agreement.

5.5 Third Party Administrator Responsibilities Regarding Content and Product Use

If you are managing or using any Product on behalf of an End User, you are deemed to be an "Administrator" for purposes of this Agreement (in addition to your being the Client). As an Administrator, you represent and warrant that you are acting on behalf of the End User party who is in the principal and that you are acting within the scope of your agency. Accordingly, you agree to obtain End User's authorization and comply with End User's instructions at all times with respect to use of the Product and access to Content, including but not limited to service subscriptions, device settings, backup settings, access controls, management, retention and deletion of Content. You also agree to notify us if your agency arrangement with the End User expires or is otherwise terminated, and you agree to cooperate in the transition of Products and Services or Content to a different Administrator or to the End User.

5.6 Client Reservation of Other Rights to Client's Content

Except for the limited license granted hereunder, Client and the End User retains all of their existing rights in and to Content. {{doc.our_company}} will use and process the Content only as necessary to provide Services and support the Products and will not otherwise access Content other than as permitted under this Agreement, or as authorized by Client, an Administrator or the End User for support.

6.0 Service Subscriptions

6.1 Service Subscription Required

Your right to use a Product requires that you be enrolled in a Service Subscription for which we receive timely payments.

6.2 Registration

You are required to register each Product with us in order to use the Products and Services. During registration, you agree to provide accurate and complete information, and you further agree to promptly update this information should it change. If a Product is not properly registered in a current paid Service Subscription, we have no obligation to allow access to or use of the Product, nor to provide any related Services.

6.3 Service Plan

Each Service Subscription specifies a particular Service Plan. All Service Plans include licenses to the technology needed to conduct the Service, backup and business continuity functions and access to {{doc.our_company}} technical support.

6.4 Term Length

The term of a Service Subscription is indicated on the applicable order. A term is for a defined number of consecutive months or years ('Committed Service Term'). Certain Products and Services and/or hardware discounts may be available only when purchased with a Committed Service Term. A Service Subscription shall commence on the 'Activation Date.' The Activation Date for a Monthly Term (and the associated payment obligation) shall be the first day of the month following the Activation Date. For an Annual Term, the Activation Date shall be the earlier of (a) the date you register a Product/Service with us and (b) the date that is sixty (60) days following date on which you order the Service Subscription. If your purchase involves a Product that includes a physical device, the purchase date for the purposes of the Section shall be the activation date of the Product. The Activation Date for Products and Services sold on a per license basis is the purchase date, regardless of when the licenses are registered. If licenses in a Service Subscription are purchased for a Committed Service Term, that Committed Service Term will apply for those licenses and for any additional licenses of the same Product/Service (unless you purchase additional licenses for a Monthly Term, if permitted for such Product). The number of licenses, including any licenses added after the start of the original Service Subscription, may not be decreased during the Committed Service Term. Additional licenses, if any, are prorated for the remainder of the then-current Committed Service Term as provided in the order.

6.5 Renewals

The term of a Service Subscription for a Monthly Term or a Committed Service Term will automatically renew on a month-to-month basis unless (a) renewed by you for an additional Committed Service Term or (b) terminated by your delivery to {{doc.our_company}} of timely written notice of cancellation. For a Monthly Term, notice of cancellation must be received by {{doc.our_company}} no later than fifteen (15) calendar days prior to the effective month of cancellation. For a Committed Term, notice of cancellation must be received by {{doc.our_company}} no later than thirty (30) calendar days prior to the effective month of cancellation. Any Service Subscription that is not renewed for an additional Committed Service Term or timely cancelled as required above will be renewed automatically for the following month on the date immediately following the date on which such notice of cancellation was required under this Section 6.5.

6.6 Payment Terms

Monthly Service Subscription fees are set forth in the applicable quote or sales order. Service Subscription fees will be due and payable commencing on the first day of the month following the Activation Date and are billed monthly in advance on the first day of the month. In the first month following the Activation Date, an additional bill will be generated covering the period from the Activation Date through the end of that month.

6.6.2       Monthly payments for a Service Subscription are due on the Activation Date day of each month by your electronic payment method.

6.6.3      You may also choose to prepay a Service Subscription. In the event of termination of a prepaid Service Subscription, no refund for unused Service will be given unless otherwise agreed to in writing.

6.6.4       You agree to pay Service Subscription fees for the entire Committed Service Term. If you terminate Service at any time during a Committed Service Term, a lump sum payment (equal to 100% of the monthly unpaid Service Subscription fees times the number of months remaining in the Committed Service Term) shall be due and immediately and charged to your preferred payment method.

6.6.5      {{doc.our_company}} may terminate any Service Subscription at its discretion, effective immediately, for non-payment that is not substantially cured within ten (10) days after your receipt of written notice.

7.0 Nondisclosure

7.1 Confidential Information

Each party (in such capacity, a “Disclosing Party”) may (but is not required to) disclose certain of its confidential and proprietary information to the other party (in such capacity, a “Receiving Party”). “Confidential Information” means:

7.1.1.      information relating to the Disclosing Party or its current or proposed business, including financial statements, budgets and projections, customer identifying information, potential and intended customers, employers, vendors, partners, products, computer programs, specifications, manuals, software, analyses, strategies, marketing plans, business plans, and other confidential information, whether provided orally, in writing, or by any other media, that was or will be:

(a)      provided or shown to the Receiving Party or its directors, officers, employees, agents, and representatives (each a “Receiving Party Representative”) by or on behalf of the Disclosing Party or any of its directors, officers, employees, agents, and representatives (each a “Disclosing Party

Representative”); or
(b)      obtained by the Receiving Party or a Receiving Party Representative from review of documents or property of, or communications with, the Disclosing Party or a Disclosing Party Representative; and

7.1.2      All notes, analyses, compilations, studies, summaries, and other material, whether provided orally, in writing, or by any other media, that contain or are based on all or part of the information described in subsection 7.1.1 (the "Derivative Materials").

7.2 Identification of Confidential Information

The Disclosing Party shall identify Confidential Information disclosed orally within 30 days of disclosure. The Disclosing Party's failure to identify information as Confidential Information is not an acknowledgment or admission by the Receiving Party that the information is not a waiver by the Disclosing Party of any of its rights with respect to that information.

7.3 Obligation to Maintain Confidentiality

7.3.1       Confidentiality: The Receiving Party shall, and shall ensure that each Receiving Party Representative shall, keep the Confidential Information Confidential. Except as otherwise required by law or except as authorized in writing by the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party and Receiving Party Representatives may not (a) disclose any Confidential Information to any Person or entity other than a Receiving Party Representative who needs to know the Confidential Information for the purposes of its business with the Disclosing Party and who has signed a confidentiality agreement containing confidentiality obligations substantially similar to those set forth in this Section 7, or (b) use the Confidential Information for any purposes other than those contemplated by this Agreement.

7.3.2       No Reverse Engineering: The Receiving Party may not reverse engineer, disassemble, or decompile any prototypes, software, or other tangible that embody the Disclosing Party's Confidential Information and that are provided to the Receiving Party under this Agreement.

7.4 Exclusions

The obligations and restrictions of this Section 7 do not apply to that part of the Confidential Information as to which the Receiving Party demonstrates that any of the following applies:

7.4.1       Public Availability: The information was or becomes generally publicly available other than as a result of a disclosure by the Receiving Party in violation of this Agreement;

7.4.2       Prior Availability: The information was or becomes available to the Receiving Party on a nonconfidential basis before its disclosure to the Receiving Party by the Disclosing Party or a Disclosing Party Representative, but only if (a) to the reasonable knowledge of the Receiving Party, the Confidential Information is not bound by a confidentiality agreement, (b) the Receiving Party is not otherwise prohibited from transmitting the information to the Receiving Party or a Receiving Party Representative by a contractual, legal, fiduciary, or other obligation; and (b) the Receiving Party provides the Disclosing Party with written notice of such possession either (i) before the execution and delivery of this agreement or (ii) if the Receiving Party later becomes aware (through disclosure to the Receiving Party) of any aspect of the Confidential Information as to which the Receiving Party had prior possession, promptly on the Receiving Party's becoming aware.

7.4.3       Legal Compulsion: The information is requested or legally compelled (by oral questions, interrogatories, requests for documents, subpoena, civil or criminal investigative demand, or similar process), or is required by a regulatory body, to be disclosed. However, prior to making any disclosure pursuant thereto, the Receiving Party shall first (a) provide the Disclosing Party with prompt notice, except where legally prohibited, and (b) may seek an appropriate protective order or other appropriate remedy, and (b) provide reasonable assistance to the Disclosing Party in obtaining any such protective order. If a protective order or other remedy is not obtained or is unavailing, the Receiving Party may furnish that portion (and only that portion) of the Confidential Information that, in the written opinion of counsel reasonably acceptable to the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party is legally compelled to disclose. The Receiving Party shall make reasonable efforts to obtain reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded any part of the Confidential Information so disclosed.

7.4.4       Independent Development: The information was developed by the Receiving Party independently without breach of this Agreement.

7.5 Return of Property

Not later than thirty (30) days after a request by the Disclosing Party, the Receiving Party shall (and shall cause each Receiving Party Representative) to return all Confidential Information to the Disclosing Party, destroy all Derivative Material, and provide a written certification to the Disclosing Party confirming the destruction.

7.6 Ownership Rights

Each party acknowledges that the Confidential Information is, and at all times will be, the Disclosing Party's sole property, even if suggestions made by a Receiving Party are incorporated into the Confidential Information. Except for any license granted by Client to {{doc.our_company}} in this Agreement, neither party obtains any rights, by license or otherwise, in the other party's Confidential Information. Neither party shall solicit any change in the other party's organization, business practice, service or products, and the disclosure of the Confidential Information may not be construed as evidencing any intent by a party to purchase any products or services of the other party or as an encouragement to expend funds in development or research efforts. The Confidential Information may pertain to prospective or unannounced products or services. Neither party may use the other party's Confidential Information as a basis on which to develop or have a third party develop a competing or similar plan or undertaking.

7.7 Future Products and Services; Residuals

The confidentiality terms of this Agreement do not limit either party's right to develop or acquire products or services independently without use of the other party's Confidential Information. Further, each party may use for any purpose the residuals resulting from access to or work with the other party's Confidential Information.Confidential Information. However, neither party may disclose the other party’s Confidential Information except as expressly permitted under this agreement. The term “residuals” means information in intangible form that is retained in memory by people who have had access to the Confidential Information, including ideas, concepts, know-how, or techniques contained in that Confidential Information. Neither party is required to limit or restrict the assignment of such persons or to pay royalties for any work resulting from the use of residuals. This Section does not give either party a license under the other party’s copyrights or patents

7.8 No Warranty

All Confidential Information is provided "as is". Neither party makes any warranties, express, implied, or otherwise, regarding the accuracy, completeness, or performance of any such information.

8.5 No Lost Profits or Punitive Damages

Neither {{doc.our_company}} nor Client, nor any of their employees, agents, or affiliates, shall be liable to other for any lost profits or any other indirect, special, incidental or consequential loss or damages of any kind, or for any loss that could have been avoided by the damaged party's use of reasonable diligence, even if the party responsible for the damages has been advised or should be aware of the possibility of such damages. Therefore, Client hereby agrees to release and hold harmless {{doc.our_company}} from and against any and all liability associated with the performance of Services and the provision of Products. Client agrees that in the event of any damage to Client's hardware and/or software, Client shall be fully and solely responsible for all costs to restore the hardware and software to operating conditions. {{doc.our_company}} is not liable to Client for failing to provide Products or Services unless such failure results from our breach of this Agreement, our gross negligence, or our willful misconduct. Notwithstanding anything in the agreement to the contrary, {{doc.our_company}} shall have no liability hereunder for death or personal injury.

The maximum aggregate monetary liability of {{doc.our_company}} and any of its employees, agents, or affiliates in connection with the Services, the Products, this Agreement, and any act or omission related thereto, under any theory of law (including breach of contract, tort, strict liability, violation of law, and infringement) shall not exceed: (i) for {{doc.our_company}} Service, an amount that is three (3) months fees under the agreement for the Services that are the subject of the claim, at the time of the occurrence of the events giving rise to the claim, (ii) for supplementary Services, three (3) months total service fees paid for the supplementary Services that are the subject of the claim, and (iii) for Products, the cost paid by Client to {{doc.our_company}} for the Product that is the subject of the claim. 24.0   PRICING FOR CERTAIN ADDITIONAL OPTIONAL SERVICES

The following services can be added to any Service Order at the prices set forth below.

Service
Name

Description

AvePoint SaaS backup
AvePoint Backup
ensures you can recover from permissions fiascos, corrupt content, or complex data loss scenarios. Cloud-to cloud backup can help make the best of a worst-case scenario. Whether it's user error, an outage, or a ransomware attack—you need a backup. Features Anytime access, Long-term retention, and flexible, granular roll-back to avoid data loss upon restore.
FedRAMP Keeper Password Manager
Password Manager for mobile and computer
SIEM Solution
All SIEM logs will be pointing to the Microsoft GCC High Cloud Sentinel for which you already have a license for. Hopefully you have G3 or G5 licenses. If for any reason we have technology assets that cannot send their logs to the Azure Sentinel cloud, our client will be required to purchase a centralize compliance premise base SIEM solution
DUO 2FA
DUO 2FA (Two-Factor Authentication)
is a security system provided by Duo Security, a company specializing in multi-factor authentication (MFA) services. Duo 2FA adds an additional layer of security beyond just a username and password by requiring a second factor to verify a user's identity when logging into systems, applications, or networks.
Backup of physical servers or NAS devices
This must be dealt with after our discovery.

Client shall take no action, nor omit to take any required action, which would cause either party to violate the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act of 1977 or the U.S. Export Administration Regulations.
32.0    PUBLICITY
Client hereby grants {{doc.our_company}} the right to use Client's name and logo on Brea Network's website or presentations, press releases, to indicate that Client is a client of {{doc.our_company}}, and, upon prior consent, to use Client's name and logo in promotional materials and published case studies.
33.0    GENERAL PROVISIONS

33.1 Governing Law

This Agreement shall be construed and interpreted in accordance with, and shall be governed and enforced in all respects according to, the laws of the State of California. All claims relating to or arising out of this Agreement, or the breach thereof, whether sounding in contract, tort or otherwise, shall likewise be governed by the laws of the State of California. No effect shall be given to any choice of law or conflict of law provision, principal or rule (whether of the State of California or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of California.

33.2 Consent to Jurisdiction and Service of Process

All judicial proceedings brought against any party hereto arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be brought in a state or federal court of competent jurisdiction in the County of Orange, State of California, and by execution and delivery of this Agreement each party accepts for itself and in connection with its properties, generally and unconditionally, the exclusive jurisdiction of the aforesaid courts (both personal jurisdiction and subject matter jurisdiction), waives any defense of forum non conveniens and irrevocably agrees to be bound by any judgment rendered thereby in connection with this Agreement. Each party hereby agrees that service of all process in any such proceeding in any such court may be made by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested, to any other party at its address provided herein, such service being hereby acknowledged by each party to be sufficient for personal jurisdiction in any action against said party in any such court and to be otherwise effective and binding service in every respect. Nothing herein shall affect the right to serve process in any other manner permitted by law.

33.3 Severability

In the event that any term or provision of this Agreement shall be held to be invalid, illegal or unenforceable in any respect, then such invalidity, illegality or unenforceability shall not affect any other provision thereof, and this Agreement shall be construed as if such invalid, illegal, or unenforceable term or provision had never been contained herein. The remainder of this Agreement shall not be affecte

33.4 Mediation of Disputes

Before either party may bring litigation or arbitration against the other to enforce any provision of this Agreement or resolve any dispute hereunder, the parties shall be required to engage in non-binding mediation pursuant to the terms of this Section. The party initiating mediation shall provide written notice to the other party of the initiating party’s decision to mediate. Within fifteen (15) days thereafter, the parties shall select a mediator by mutual agreement. The parties shall endeavor to select a mediator who is a retired judge or an attorney with at least five (5) years of experience in adjudicating and mediating computer services contract disputes. If the parties are unable to agree upon a mediator within said fifteen (15) day period, then the Parties shall submit the matter to the JAMS (Judicial Arbitration and Mediation Service) at its Orange County, California office for selection of a mediator in accordance with Rule 15 of JAMS’s Comprehensive Arbitration Rules & Procedures dated June 1, 2021, or any subsequently adopted version thereof. The location of the mediation shall be at the above-referenced JAMS’s office, or at another location mutually acceptable to the parties. The costs of mediation shall be shared equally by both parties. The mediator shall provide an independent assessment on the merits of the dispute and recommendations for resolution. All discussions that occur during the mediation and all documents prepared solely for the purpose of the mediation shall be confidential and privileged pursuant to California Evidence Code Sections 1119 and 1152. If the dispute is not resolved by mediation within sixty (60) days following selection of the mediator, then the mediation procedures shall be immediately terminated (unless continued by the mutual consent of the Parties) and either or both Parties may proceed to litigation or binding arbitration to enforce this Agreement or resolve the dispute. Notwithstanding the foregoing, {{doc.our_company}} may file a lawsuit against Client for the purposes of seeking injunctive relief under Section 33.14 below without first engaging or seeking to engage in mediation pursuant to this Section 33.4.

33.5 Integration and Amendment

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement of the parties hereto and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous representations, proposals, discussions, and communications, whether oral or in writing. This Agreement may be modified only in writing and shall be enforceable in accordance with its terms when signed by each of the parties hereto.

33.6 Force Majeure

If either party is delayed or hindered in, or prevented from, the performance of any act required under this Agreement by reason of a “Force Majeure” as defined below, then performance of such act will be excused for the period of delay and the period for the performance of any such act will be extended for a period equivalent to the period of such delay. Notwithstanding the foregoing, however, nothing in this Section shall excuse either party from the prompt payment of any amounts owing by that party under this Agreement. Further notwithstanding the foregoing, no Force Majeure event shall excuse the delay of either party’s performance by more than sixty (60) days. As used herein, the term “Force Majeure” means any one or more of the following to the extent not caused by the party claiming the delay: (a) fire, earthquake, flood or other natural disaster; (b) interruption of any public utilities, including without limitation electricity, gas, water, sewer or telephone service; (c) governmental action or inaction, including without limitation failure, refusal or delay in issuing permits, approvals and/or authorizations; (d) governmental declarations of local, regional, state-wide or national emergencies, including without limitation governmental declarations which mandate or recommend the full or partial closure of the performing party’s business; (e) restrictive governmental laws, regulations or orders; (f) strikes, lock-outs, or similar labor interruptions; (g) inability to procure necessary construction materials; (h) riots, civil unrest or insurrection; (i) criminal activity; (j) terrorism; (k) war; (l) epidemics; (m) quarantines; or (n) any other unusual and unforeseeable delay not within the reasonable control of the party delayed.

33.7 Attorneys’ Fees

If either party brings suit against the other with respect to this Agreement, then all costs and expenses, including without limitation actual professional fees and costs such as appraisers’ accountants’ experts’, and attorneys’ fees and costs, incurred by the prevailing party (whether that party prevails by final judgment or out-of-court settlement) shall be paid by the losing party. The losing party’s obligation shall be deemed to have accrued on the date of the commencement of such actions (but shall include all related fees and expenses incurred prior to such commencement) and shall be enforceable whether or not the action is prosecuted to judgment. As used herein, the term “attorneys’ fees and costs” shall include, without limitation, attorneys’ fees, arbitrators’ fees, witness fees, court and arbitration costs, and expenses incurred in connection with any (a) bankruptcy litigation, (b) contempt proceedings, (c) debtor and third-party examinations, (d) discovery, (e) garnishment and levy proceedings, (f) pre-judgment and post-judgment motions, and (g) trial preparation and presentation. As used herein, the term “prevailing party” shall include, without limitation, (h) any party against whom a cause of action, complaint, cross-complaint, counter-claim, cross-claim or third-party complaint is voluntarily dismissed, with or without prejudice, where that party has paid no consideration for the dismissal or where the dismissing party did not obtain the relief it sought, (i) a party who dismisses an action in exchange for sums allegedly due, (j) the party who receives performance from the other party for an alleged breach of contract or a desired remedy where the performance is substantially equal to the relief sought in an action, (k) the party who receives any award for relief through arbitration, or (l) the party determined to be the prevailing party by a court of law.

33.8 Counterparts

This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original but all of which shall constitute one and the same instrument. In addition, this Agreement may contain more than one counterpart of the signature page and may be executed by the affixing of the signatures of each of the parties to any one of such counterpart signature pages; all of such counterpart signature pages shall read as though one and they shall have the same force and effect as though all of the signers had signed a single signature page.

33.9 Digital Signatures

Signatures to this Agreement transmitted by facsimile (fax) or in the form of a digital image – including without limitation PDF, JPEG and/or GIF files, or any electronic signature complying with the U.S. Federal ESIGN Act of 2000 (15 USC § 7001 et seq.) or California’s Uniform Electronic Transactions Act (Cal. Civil Code § 1633.1 et seq.) – shall be valid and effective to bind the party so signing; each party agrees to promptly deliver an execution original of this Agreement with its actual signature to each other party, but a failure to do so shall not affect the enforceability of this Agreement, it being expressly agreed that each party to this Agreement shall be bound by its own facsimile, scanned or other electronic signature and shall accept the telecopied or scanned signature of each other party to this Agreement.

33.10 Further Assurances

Each party shall cooperate with the other and shall execute such other documents as may be reasonably necessary to carry out the provisions of this Agreement

33.11 No Waiver

Any waiver, consent or approval by either party of any breach, default or event of default of any provision, condition or covenant of this Agreement must be in writing and shall be effective only to the extent set forth in writing. No waiver of any breach, default or event of default shall be deemed a waiver of any later breach, default or event of default of the same or any other provision of this Agreement. A failure or delay on the part of either party in exercising any power, right or privilege under this Agreement shall not operate as a waiver thereof, nor shall any single or partial exercise of any such power, right or privilege preclude any further exercise thereof.

33.12 Rights and Remedies

No right or remedy conferred by any of the specific provisions of this Agreement is intended to be exclusive of any other right or remedy given hereunder or hereafter existing at law or in equity. The exercise of any one or more rights or the election of any one or more remedies by any party shall not constitute a waiver of the right to exercise other available rights or pursue other available remedies

33.13 Joint and Several Liability

To the extent that Client constitutes more than one person or entity, then the obligations of each such person or entity shall be joint and several.

33.14 Injunctive Relief

Client understands and agrees that in the event of any breach of this Agreement by Client, {{doc.our_company}} would be irreparably and immediately harmed and could not be made whole by monetary damages. Accordingly, Client agrees that {{doc.our_company}}, in addition to any other remedy which it may have at law or in equity, shall be entitled to injunctive relief to prevent breaches of this Agreement and/or specific performance to compel compliance with this Agreement. As use herein, the term “injunctive relief” includes, without limitation, temporary, preliminary, final injunctions, temporary restraining orders, and temporary protective orders, all to enforce the terms of this Agreement in the event of breach or threatened breach by Client. The obligations contained in this Agreement are independent of any other obligations between the parties, and the existence of any other claim or cause of action against either party is not a defense to [my client’s] enforcement of obligations hereunder by injunction. Nothing contained in this paragraph or elsewhere in this Agreement shall be deemed or construed to constitute a waiver of any rights or remedies of {{doc.our_company}}, whether provided by statute or common law. Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 33.4 above, {{doc.our_company}} shall have the right to file a lawsuit against Client for the purpose of seeking injunctive relief without first seeking to mediate any dispute
